title: Lebanon Cease-Fire Appears to Hold Despite Israeli Strike
content: Israel said it had targeted militants headed to a rocket facility, but neither Israel nor Hezbollah seemed keen to immediately return to full-scale fighting.
summary: Israel said it had targeted militants headed to a rocket facility, but neither Israel nor Hezbollah seemed keen to immediately return to full-scale fighting.

title: With Trump Returning and Hezbollah Weakened, Iran Strikes a Conciliatory Tone
content: As Iran faces domestic and foreign challenges, its bellicose rhetoric on the United States and Israel has given way to signs that it wants less confrontation.
summary: As Iran faces domestic and foreign challenges, its bellicose rhetoric on the United States and Israel has given way to signs that it wants less confrontation.

title: Indian Thieves See a Gold Mine in Exams for Government Jobs
content: In a country where government jobs are highly coveted, the tests that govern hiring are a lucrative target for criminal gangs.
summary: In a country where government jobs are highly coveted, the tests that govern hiring are a lucrative target for criminal gangs.

title: Daniel Khalife, UK Prison Escapee, Is Convicted of Spying for Iran
content: Daniel Khalife also pleaded guilty to an escape from a London jail, strapped underneath a truck with a sling made of trousers, that embarrassed the British authorities.
summary: Daniel Khalife also pleaded guilty to an escape from a London jail, strapped underneath a truck with a sling made of trousers, that embarrassed the British authorities.

title: Hiker Survives 50 Days in Canadian Wilderness
content: Sam Benastick was found after weeks missing in British Columbia’s frigid Redfern-Keily Provincial Park, and after the official search was called off. The police had feared “this would not be the outcome,” a spokeswoman said.
summary: Sam Benastick was found after weeks missing in British Columbia’s frigid Redfern-Keily Provincial Park, and after the official search was called off. The police had feared “this would not be the outcome,” a spokeswoman said.

title: Romania Court Orders a Recount After Surprise Election Result
content: A top court issued the ruling just days after an ultranationalist outsider unexpectedly won the most votes in the first round of presidential elections held Sunday.
summary: A top court issued the ruling just days after an ultranationalist outsider unexpectedly won the most votes in the first round of presidential elections held Sunday.

title: 850-Year-Old Smithfield Meat Market in London to Close
content: The historic site in Britain’s capital has been a market for centuries. The local authority voted this week to close it.
summary: The historic site in Britain’s capital has been a market for centuries. The local authority voted this week to close it.

title: What a Deadly Offensive in Syria Means for a Stalled Civil War
content: Rebel groups have launched the largest offensive in years against government forces in the northwest.
summary: Rebel groups have launched the largest offensive in years against government forces in the northwest.

title: Bangladesh Ties with India Plunge Further After Arrest of Hindu Leader
content: India and Bangladesh have traded angry accusations about Bangladesh’s Hindu minority.
summary: India and Bangladesh have traded angry accusations about Bangladesh’s Hindu minority.

title: Chinese Women Mobilize Against Subpar Sanitary Pads
content: An online campaign has prompted major pad manufacturers to apologize. Regulators said they would consider women’s criticisms when writing new standards.
summary: An online campaign has prompted major pad manufacturers to apologize. Regulators said they would consider women’s criticisms when writing new standards.

title: Australia Bans Social Media for Everyone Under 16
content: The law sets a minimum age for users of platforms like TikTok, Instagram and X. How the restriction will be enforced online remains an open question.
summary: The law sets a minimum age for users of platforms like TikTok, Instagram and X. How the restriction will be enforced online remains an open question.

title: E.U. Vessels Surround Anchored Chinese Ship After Cables Are Severed in Baltic Sea
content: Multiple countries are investigating and the authorities in Europe say they have not ruled out sabotage. But U.S. intelligence officials have assessed that the cables were not cut deliberately.
summary: Multiple countries are investigating and the authorities in Europe say they have not ruled out sabotage. But U.S. intelligence officials have assessed that the cables were not cut deliberately.

title: India’s Exam Leaks Underline the Nation’s Bigger Problem
content: The economy has failed to create enough good jobs, so a government post appeals to far more people than there are openings, fueling desperation.
summary: The economy has failed to create enough good jobs, so a government post appeals to far more people than there are openings, fueling desperation.

title: Russia Strikes Ukraine’s Energy Sector as Putin Signals More to Come
content: Ukraine said the attacks targeted energy infrastructure. President Vladimir V. Putin said they were retaliation for Kyiv’s use of long-range American missiles.
summary: Ukraine said the attacks targeted energy infrastructure. President Vladimir V. Putin said they were retaliation for Kyiv’s use of long-range American missiles.

title: China Journalist, Dong Yuyu, Is Sentenced to Prison for Espionage
content: Dong Yuyu, who has written articles critical of the Communist Party, was arrested in 2022 while having lunch with a Japanese diplomat.
summary: Dong Yuyu, who has written articles critical of the Communist Party, was arrested in 2022 while having lunch with a Japanese diplomat.

title: A Dublin Neighborhood at the Sharp End of Ireland’s Election Issues
content: In a northeast neighborhood of the capital city, deprivation and affluence exist side-by-side, and many voters feel frustrated by the status quo.
summary: In a northeast neighborhood of the capital city, deprivation and affluence exist side-by-side, and many voters feel frustrated by the status quo.

title: Why Mexico Is Eliminating Independent Watchdog Agencies
content: A vote in the country’s Senate has cleared the way to abolish seven independent organizations that provided oversight on issues such as public information and price fixing.
summary: A vote in the country’s Senate has cleared the way to abolish seven independent organizations that provided oversight on issues such as public information and price fixing.

title: Canada Accuses Google of Creating Advertising Tech Monopoly
content: The case largely echoes an antitrust action in the United States and seeks to force Google to sell off sections of its online ad business.
summary: The case largely echoes an antitrust action in the United States and seeks to force Google to sell off sections of its online ad business.

title: Lebanese Residents of Baalbek Return to a Bombed-Out City
content: Tens of thousands of people who had fled the city of Baalbek returned to bombed-out restaurants, flattened apartment buildings and many of the dead still buried under the rubble.
summary: Tens of thousands of people who had fled the city of Baalbek returned to bombed-out restaurants, flattened apartment buildings and many of the dead still buried under the rubble.

title: What to Know About Australia’s Social Media Ban for Children Under 16
content: Critics say big questions remain not only about how the new law will be enforced, but also about whether the ban will really protect young people.
summary: Critics say big questions remain not only about how the new law will be enforced, but also about whether the ban will really protect young people.

title: A Top Military Official in China Is Suspended Under Suspicion of Corruption
content: The case of Adm. Miao Hua suggests the persistence of graft at high levels of the military, despite the efforts by Xi Jinping to stamp out corruption.
summary: The case of Adm. Miao Hua suggests the persistence of graft at high levels of the military, despite the efforts by Xi Jinping to stamp out corruption.

title: President João Lourenco of Angola Discusses Biden’s Upcoming Visit
content: President João Lourenço of Angola has worked hard to strengthen his country’s partnership with the United States and says the recent election won’t derail that.
summary: President João Lourenço of Angola has worked hard to strengthen his country’s partnership with the United States and says the recent election won’t derail that.

title: Hamas Faces a Future Without Its Most Important Ally
content: Israel’s offensive against Hezbollah and the cease-fire to stop the fighting in Lebanon have left Hamas increasingly isolated.

title: The U.S. Is Building an Early Warning System to Detect Geoengineering
content: Balloon launches from around the world are part of a new kind of global alarm system: One that can detect if another country tries to dim the sun.

title: Thursday Briefing
content: The first day of a truce between Hezbollah and Israel.

content: As international talks continue this week, a dozen U.N. officials reveal scientists tracked their exposure to many chemicals found in plastics.
summary: As international talks continue this week, a dozen U.N. officials reveal scientists tracked their exposure to many chemicals found in plastics.

title: Syrian Rebel Groups Launch Largest Offensive in Years

summary: Scores of people were killed after forces opposed to the government of President Bashar al-Assad overtook a Syrian military base, a monitoring group reported.

title: How Have Israel and Lebanon Responded to the Cease-Fire?
content: The truce began Wednesday, bringing a fragile peace to Israel and Lebanon. Israeli troops are to withdraw in phases  from southern Lebanon, and Lebanese military convoys headed south to protect the peace.
summary: The truce began Wednesday, bringing a fragile peace to Israel and Lebanon. Israeli troops are to withdraw in phases  from southern Lebanon, and Lebanese military convoys headed south to protect the peace.

title: As Israel-Hezbollah Cease-Fire Takes Hold, Thousands in Lebanon Head Home
content: The cease-fire between Israel and Hezbollah began on Wednesday, but much hardship and uncertainty lie ahead after a yearlong war that killed thousands and left widespread destruction in Lebanon.
summary: The cease-fire between Israel and Hezbollah began on Wednesday, but much hardship and uncertainty lie ahead after a yearlong war that killed thousands and left widespread destruction in Lebanon.

title: Northern Israel Somber as a Few Soldiers and Residents Trickle Through
content: While there were limited signs of life in the area, most residents were hesitant to head back without greater certainty that the cease-fire with Hezbollah would hold.
summary: While there were limited signs of life in the area, most residents were hesitant to head back without greater certainty that the cease-fire with Hezbollah would hold.

content: The country’s military leader has been accused of crimes against humanity over the army’s persecution of the Rohingya ethnic group.

title: Pakistan’s Capital Is Turned Upside Down by Unending Protests
content: Residents of Islamabad are tiring of regular demonstrations demanding the release of the former prime minister Imran Khan, with the marches leading to clashes with security forces.
summary: Residents of Islamabad are tiring of regular demonstrations demanding the release of the former prime minister Imran Khan, with the marches leading to clashes with security forces.

title: Moscow Expels 2 German Journalists Over Allegations of Closing Russian TV Bureau
content: The German government denied it had taken action against Russia’s Channel One office in Berlin but said two Russian journalists no longer had residency permits.
summary: The German government denied it had taken action against Russia’s Channel One office in Berlin but said two Russian journalists no longer had residency permits.

title: French Intellectuals Decry Dissident Writer Boualem Sansal’s Arrest in Algeria
content: An outspoken French-Algerian novelist returned to his homeland and was promptly taken into custody at age 75.
summary: An outspoken French-Algerian novelist returned to his homeland and was promptly taken into custody at age 75.

title: Israeli Forces Keep Striking in Gaza Alongside Cease-Fire in Lebanon
content: While Israel and Hezbollah were finalizing a cease-fire to halt the fighting in Lebanon, Israeli strikes killed 33 people in Gaza, according to local health authorities.
summary: While Israel and Hezbollah were finalizing a cease-fire to halt the fighting in Lebanon, Israeli strikes killed 33 people in Gaza, according to local health authorities.

title: A Battered and Diminished Hezbollah Accepts a Cease-Fire
content: Thirteen months of war left Hezbollah weakened, isolated and desperate for a way to stop the fighting.
summary: Thirteen months of war left Hezbollah weakened, isolated and desperate for a way to stop the fighting.

title: France Suggests It Would Not Immediately Arrest Netanyahu Despite I.C.C. Warrant
content: The Foreign Ministry did not say outright that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel would be free to travel to France, but it argued that an I.C.C. rule on immunity may apply to him.
summary: The Foreign Ministry did not say outright that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel would be free to travel to France, but it argued that an I.C.C. rule on immunity may apply to him.

title: Oxford University Names William Hague Its New Chancellor
content: Mr. Hague, a former leader of Britain’s Conservative Party, was chosen in a vote by his fellow alumni to lead the elite university.
summary: Mr. Hague, a former leader of Britain’s Conservative Party, was chosen in a vote by his fellow alumni to lead the elite university.

title: 3 Americans Are Said to Be Freed From China in Prisoner Swap
content: The Americans released, among others, a Chinese intelligence officer who was serving a 20-year sentence in the United States.
summary: The Americans released, among others, a Chinese intelligence officer who was serving a 20-year sentence in the United States.

title: The Israel-Hezbollah Cease-Fire: What to Know
content: Under the agreement, Israel will gradually withdraw its forces from Lebanon over the next 60 days, and Hezbollah will not entrench itself near the Israeli border.
summary: Under the agreement, Israel will gradually withdraw its forces from Lebanon over the next 60 days, and Hezbollah will not entrench itself near the Israeli border.

title: Mystery Drones Spotted Over U.S. Air Bases in Britain
content: Small, unmanned craft were seen flying over four bases in England, the U.S. Air Force in Europe said. The Pentagon said that there had not been “any significant mission impact.”
summary: Small, unmanned craft were seen flying over four bases in England, the U.S. Air Force in Europe said. The Pentagon said that there had not been “any significant mission impact.”

title: Cease-Fire Deal Leaves Beleaguered Palestinians in Gaza Feeling Forgotten

summary: With a truce between Israel and Hezbollah taking hold, Gazans are losing hope that Israel’s war in the enclave will end anytime soon.

title: I.C.C. Prosecutor Seeks Arrest Warrant for Myanmar Junta Leader
content: The International Criminal Court’s chief prosecutor accused Senior Gen. Min Aung Hlaing of crimes against humanity toward the country’s Muslim Rohingya.
summary: The International Criminal Court’s chief prosecutor accused Senior Gen. Min Aung Hlaing of crimes against humanity toward the country’s Muslim Rohingya.

title: With Joy and Tears, Lebanese Return Home: ‘Look at All the Destruction’
content: A cease-fire between Israel and Hezbollah allowed those displaced by the war to return to their homes. Many found buildings cleaved in half, crushed cars and ruined towns.
summary: A cease-fire between Israel and Hezbollah allowed those displaced by the war to return to their homes. Many found buildings cleaved in half, crushed cars and ruined towns.

title: Will the Hezbollah Cease-Fire Draw Back Northern Israel Residents Displaced by War?
content: Some of the tens of thousands of Israelis displaced by the war with Hezbollah worried whether it was safe to go home.

title: Will Lebanon Deal Break Gaza Deadlock? Experts Doubt It
content: Hamas is unlikely to compromise in Gaza, despite the decision by its ally, Hezbollah, to stop fighting. A deal in Gaza would also be harder for Benjamin Netanyahu, the Israeli prime minister.

title: Two Presidents, Two Policies, One Superpower: America in Transition

summary: Even as President Biden brokers a cease-fire in Lebanon, President-elect Donald J. Trump is running his own foreign policy without waiting to be sworn in.

title: What Is Russia’s Oreshnik Ballistic Missile?
content: The weapon used for the first time against Ukraine last week is capable of carrying nuclear weapons.

content: A cease-fire agreement between Israel and Hezbollah.

title: Britain’s Emotional Debate Over Assisted Dying
content: As lawmakers prepare to vote on legalizing assisted suicide for the terminally ill in England and Wales, an intense public discussion has unfolded.
